intro: Hyperanthera semidecandra, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Hyperanthera semidecandra is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
